(High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContractState_ChargeFee.cs] [State: TransactionFees] [Accounting Error] Can State.TransactionFees be configured with duplicate symbols in the Fees list, causing GetBaseFeeDictionary to sum fees incorrectly and overcharge users? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContractState_ChargeFee.cs] [State: TransactionFees] [Fee Manipulation] Can State.TransactionFees[methodName].IsSizeFeeFree be set to true for critical methods like Transfer or Burn, allowing attackers to spam large transactions without size fees? [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContractState_ChargeFee.cs] [State: TransactionFees] [Integer Overflow] Can State.TransactionFees store BasicFee values that when summed in GetBaseFeeDictionary cause long overflow, resulting in negative fee amounts or zero fees? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContractState_ChargeFee.cs] [State: TransactionFees] [Fee Evasion] If State.TransactionFees is not set for a method, does ChargeTransactionFees skip base fee charging entirely, allowing free execution of potentially expensive operations? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContractState_ChargeFee.cs] [State: TransactionFees] [Symbol Manipulation] Can State.TransactionFees be set with non-existent or malicious token symbols, causing GetMethodFee to return invalid fee configurations that break fee charging logic? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContractState_ChargeFee.cs] [State: TransactionFees] [Privilege Escalation] After MethodFeeController is changed via ChangeMethodFeeController, can the old controller still modify State.TransactionFees due to missing state cleanup? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContractState_ChargeFee.cs] [State: LastPayRentTime] [Rental Evasion] Can State.LastPayRentTime be set to CurrentBlockTime repeatedly to keep duration at zero, preventing any rental charges from being applied? (Medium)
